net.sf.jsptest

Class JspTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • net.sf.jsptest.JspTestCase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlTestCase

    public abstract class JspTestCase
extends junit.framework.TestCase
    An abstract base class to be extended by the user. The JspTestCase class provides a facility for rendering a JSP and a set of assertion methods for verifying that the JSP under test renders the expected kind of output.
    Author:
    Lasse Koskela, Meinert Schwartau (scwar32), Ronaldo Webb

      • getWebRoot

        protected String getWebRoot()
        Override this method to tell the JSP compiler where the "web" files are located. Defaults to the current working directory.

      • get

        protected void get(String path)
            throws Exception
        Simulate a HTTP GET request to the specified JSP file.
        Parameters:
        path - The JSP file to render. The path should start with a "/" and is interpreted to be relative to the web root specified by getWebRoot.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • post

        protected void post(String path)
             throws Exception
        Simulate a HTTP POST request to the specified JSP file.
        Parameters:
        path - The JSP file to render. The path should start with a "/" and is interpreted to be relative to the web root specified by getWebRoot.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • request

        protected void request(String path,
           String httpMethod)
                throws Exception
        Simulate an HTTP request to a JSP.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the JSP to execute.
        httpMethod - "GET" or "POST".
        Throws:
        Exception

        protected void substituteTaglib(String name,
                    Class newImplementation)
        Invoke this method to substitute the specified taglib with the given implementation.
        Parameters:

        newImplementation - The new (substitute) implementation to use.
